revised_title: Experimental Researches in Electricity: Eleventh Series and the Invention of the Differential Inductometer
tldr: In this article, Michael Faraday describes his experimental research on specific inductive capacity and introduces the Differential Inductometer, a new instrument that can measure the differences in inductive capacity between materials. He demonstrates the device's sensitivity by using gold leaves as a test and discusses potential applications, such as examining gases and crystals.
